Because I have heard from so many small employers in Connecticut that are unable to provide coverage to their employees because of the high costs, #Med4America does not require a contribution from these employers.

#Med4America also allows employers that currently provide gold-level coverage or better to continue to offer those plans. You would also have the option to choose Medicare for America for yourself or your family if they choose not to enroll all employees in the program.

#Med4America will have no premiums or cost-sharing for any individual or family below 200% of the federal poverty level. For those between 200-600%, premiums & cost-sharing will be on a sliding scale. No one will pay more than 8% of monthly income, and there are no deductibles.

#Med4America's benefit package ensures that no matter where you live, your zip code does not determine your benefits. If you work for an employer who does not choose Medicare for America, you have the option to choose it for yourself or your family.

#Med4America expands Medicare's benefits package to include prescription drugs, dental, vision, and hearing services, as well as long-term supports and services for seniors and Americans living with disabilities.

People deserve to know their healthcare coverage will be affordable, and that it will be there for them when they need it. That is why I reintroduced Medicare for America earlier this year with @RepSchakowsky . https://navigatorresearch.org/navigating-the-medicare-debate/ …

Beyond adding dental, vision, and hearing, #Med4America includes Long-Term Services and Supports—one the most important benefits we include. No health system is truly universal unless it covers LTSS. Check out Section 2203 and Part B. #AllMeansAll https://www.congress.gov/bill/116th-congress/house-bill/2452/text?q=%7B%22search%22%3A%22medicare+for+america%22%7D …

Right now, health coverage is determined by your zip code. That is wrong. Medicaid and state mandates vary drastically, and if our goal is universal coverage, we can no longer have a system where states decide what benefits to cover. #Med4America

Many have said Medicaid for all would be better because the benefits covered are better than Medicare. That’s why the #Med4America benefits package is based on Connecticut’s HUSKY. This extensive list ensures that every American has the same strong set of benefits.

#Med4America expands Medicare to include an extensive benefits package, caps premiums & out-of-pocket costs, will have no deductibles, and gives Medicare the power to bring down high drug costs. In short, it would ensure everyone has access to high-quality, affordable coverage.

Ensuring the resources we appropriate are used for their intended purpose and that there are proper legal protections for the kids in our care should not be up for debate.

That is wrong, and we must immediately hold the Administration accountable to fix the situation. We cannot give this administration a blank check when time and again it has failed to show it has these children’s best interests at heart.

Many children have been waiting to be placed with relatives or sponsors for months. These failures have led to ‘irrevocable mental and physical harm’ according to lawyers and advocates fighting for these children’s rights.

Recent reports indicate the Administration has violated the Flores Agreement, which protects children from being detained for more than 20 days and sets standards for facilities they can be placed in. https://www.miamiherald.com/news/local/immigration/article231075518.html …

Over the past two years, the Trump Administration has shown boundless cruelty—turning ORR into an immigration enforcement agency. That is not the mission of HHS nor an appropriate use of HHS resources, and Congress will not continue to allow it.

That means kids need to be placed into state-licensed shelters, they should be safely and expeditiously discharged into sponsor’s care, and sponsors should feel free to come forward instead of being threatened with potential deportation.

I am ready to ensure HHS has the funding it needs to care for unaccompanied children during this humanitarian crisis, but there must be proper protections in place to ensure these kids are well taken care of. https://delauro.house.gov/media-center/press-releases/delauro-statement-ongoing-orr-supplemental-funding-negotiations …
